originalText.text:
In 2013, Dr. Lynda Mandell was acknowledged as "Most Compassionate Doctor" by Patients' Choice.
Dr. Mandell began her career in medicine as a radiation oncologist. She has worked for over 25 years at several of the nation’s most prestigious hospitals, including John’s Hopkins, Mount Sinai and Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. After becoming interested in the psychological and emotional aspects of cancer treatment, Dr. Mandell completed a second residency in 2006, allowing her to become a board-certified psychiatrist. Though she specializes in psycho-oncology, Dr. Mandell treats patients with a wide range of issues. In 2013, Dr. Mandell’s excellence in psychiatry was recognized as she received a Patient’s Choice Award for “Most Compassionate Doctor."
